message.content:
Based on the information provided, here's a customized one-week fitness plan for you:


<start>

Day 1 - Session #1
Warm-up: 5-10 minutes of stretching
Exercises and intervals: 
1. Bodyweight squats (3 sets x 10 reps)
2. Push-ups (3 sets x 10 reps)
3. Mountaineering (3 sets x 30 seconds each)
Cooldown: 5-10 minutes of stretching 
Estimated workout time: 30-40 minutes

Day 2 - Session #2
Warm-up: 5-10 minutes of jumping jacks 
Exercises and intervals: 
1. Bodyweight lunges (3 sets x 10 reps each leg)
2. Plank (3 sets x 30 seconds each)
3. Bodyweight Rows (3 sets x 10 reps)
Cooldown: 5-10 minutes of stretching 
Estimated workout time: 30-40 minutes 

Day 3 - Session #3
Warm-up: 5-10 minutes of jogging in place
Exercises and intervals: 
1. Jumping Jacks (3 sets x 20 reps)
2. Bodyweight dips (3 sets x 10 reps)
3. Mountaineering (3 sets x 30 seconds each)
Cooldown: 5-10 minutes of stretching 
Estimated workout time: 30-40 minutes

Day 4 - Session #4 
Rest day 

Day 5 - Session #5 
Warm-up: 5-10 minutes of stretching 
Exercises and intervals: 
1. Bodyweight squats (3 sets x 10 reps)
2. Bicep curls using dumbbells (3 sets x 10 reps)
3. Crunches (3 sets x 10 reps)
Cooldown: 5-10 minutes of stretching  
Estimated workout time: 30-40 minutes 

Day 6 - Session #6 
Warm-up: 5-10 minutes of jumping jacks 
Exercises and intervals: 
1. Burpees (3 sets x 10 reps)
2. Bodyweight Rows (3 sets x 8 reps)
3. Plank (3 sets x 20 seconds each) 
Cooldown: 5-10 minutes of stretching 
Estimated workout time: 30-40 minutes 

Day 7 - Session #7 
Warm-up: 5-10 minutes of jogging in place 
Exercises and intervals: 
1. Push-ups (3 sets x 10 reps) 
2. Bodyweight dips (3 sets x 10 reps)
3. Jumping Jacks (3 sets x 30 seconds each)
Cooldown: 5-10 minutes of stretching 
Estimated workout time: 30-40 minutes 

<stop>

Please keep in mind that before starting any new exercise program it is recommended to consult with a doctor, especially when there are pre-existing neurological disorders. It's important to focus on gradual progress and listen to your body to avoid injury. Good luck with your fitness journey!
